2. Modules Documentation¶

2.1. Config module¶

The L{config} module contains the L{OWTConfig} class, which is passed to the SISTRI API calls. It stores useful information such as your Web Services account private key and certificate. It is strongly suggested that you create a single L{OWTConfig} object in your project and pass that to the various API calls, rather than create new L{OWTConfig} objects haphazardly. This is merely a design suggestion, treat it as such.

class openwastetracelib.config.OWTConfig(certificate, privatekey, dbstring, wsdl=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base configuration class that is used for the different SISTRI SOAP calls. These are generally passed to the OWT request classes as arguments. You may instantiate a L{OWTConfig} object with the minimal C{certificate}, C{privatekey} and C{dbstring} arguments and set the instance variables documented below at a later time if you must.

binding¶

@ivar: The binding object.

certificate¶

@ivar: Certificate.

dbstring¶

@ivar: Database connection string.

engine¶

@ivar: Engine connected to database.

privatekey¶

@ivar: Private key.

session¶

@ivar: The session object.

storage¶

@ivar: The storage object.

2.2. Binding module¶

The I{owt_binding} module provides mapping for objects and tables.

class openwastetracelib.binding.OWTBinding(storage_obj)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base configuration class that is used for the binding. These are generally passed to the OWT request classes as arguments.

storage¶

@ivar: OWTStorage.

2.4. Storage module¶

The L{storage} module contains the L{OWTStorage} class. It stores information about storage.

class openwastetracelib.storage.OWTStorage(engine)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base configuration class that is used for the storage. These are generally passed to the OWT request classes as arguments.

engine¶

@ivar: Engine connected to database.

metadata¶

@ivar: metadata.

2.5. Https_cert module¶

HTTPS Transport for suds SOAP client using certificate and key files.

class openwastetracelib.https_cert.HTTPSClientAuthHandler(cert, key)[source]¶

Bases: urllib2.HTTPSHandler

HTTPS Client Auth solution for urllib2. Inspired by http://bugs.python.org/issue3466 and improved by David Norton of Three Pillar Software. In this implementation, we use properties passed in rather than static module fields. Found at: http://www.threepillarsoftware.com/soap_client_auth

https_open(req)[source]¶

Rather than pass in a reference to a connection class, we pass in a reference to a function which, for all intents and purposes, will behave as a constructor
